qas.question: What is the Chinese word for Christian?
What does 基督徒 (pinyin: jīdū tú) mean?
What was the original pronunciation of Jīdū?
What did the two characters read in Vietnamese?
Which Chinese term means Christ leader?
Which Japanese word means Christ follower?
Now pronounced Ki-To in Mandarin, how were the characters originally pronounced?
Now pronounced Jidu in Cantonese, how were the characters originally pronounced?

context: The Chinese word is <a0_0>基督徒 (<b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>pinyin<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/>: jīdū tú)<a0_0/>, literally "<a1_0>Christ follower<a1_0/>." The two characters now pronounced <b7_0>Jīdū<b7_0/> in Mandarin Chinese, were originally pronounced <a2_0><b8_0>Ki-To<b8_0/> in Cantonese<a2_0/> as representation of Latin "Cristo".[citation needed] In Vietnam, the same two characters read <a3_0>Cơ đốc<a3_0/>, and a "follower of Christianity" is a tín đồ Cơ đốc giáo.
